subject: Law
title: The Arrest Process
description: A quick, practical guide to The Arrest Process.

hook.text: A police officer grabs your arm and says 'you're under arrest.' What happens next is governed by strict rules.

buildup.text: An arrest requires probable causeâ€”a reasonable belief that the person committed a crime.

discovery.text: Officers usually need a warrant, but exceptions exist: crimes in their presence, hot pursuit, or emergencies.

twist.text: An illegal arrest doesn't mean you go free. But evidence found during it may be thrown out in court.

climax.text: After arrest, you must be brought before a judge promptlyâ€”usually within 48 hoursâ€”for an initial hearing.

punchline.text: Arrest starts the process. Due process protects you inside it.
